text: Good morning. Getting a gauge of how many folks are WFH vs. WFO today? I need to wait for the heat repair folks, but will be in later this PM for Leah's HH

<@U0EL0GLEL> and <@U2670DYLE> repo has been created
git clone <https://experience-spaces.googlesource.com/apps/NetContributor>
i was able to clone it
i will commit what i have to that
is there anything special in doing that?
i don't think so. I'm searching through the inbox for their doc on revision control
found this, but not the one I was thinking of <https://sites.google.com/a/google.com/experiencespaces/process/exhibit-code-review-process-source-control?pli=1>
this one: <https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/Documentation/user-upload.html#_git_push>
if needed, we can bypass review: <https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/Documentation/user-upload.html#bypass_review>
<@U02E3CRMA>
i was able to clone the repo as well
:thumbsup::skin-tone-3:
i think i have merged my repo into my local copy of the new repo, going to test and make sure i didnt break anything then push these
looks like my git history came along for the ride too
looks like my merge was fine, im pushing now
there will be lint errors havnt gone in an adjusted that yet. so hopefully there isnt some review to validate yet
the master branch has my demo on it, that had basic communication in it
the development is where im working out of
well looks like gerrit doesnt like that

Pushing to <https://experience-spaces.googlesource.com/apps/NetContributor>
POST git-receive-pack (chunked)
remote:

<@U02F9CXTL> <@U0J6TE0CA> do you want to join our hangout to touch base on UX developments
Sure logging back on!
<@U0EL0GLEL> we might have to do a push to /refs/for/master or /refs/for/development
might be worth getting Myles on a GVC with you/me/John today to get the overview of how we should be working
<@U0EL0GLEL>  and <@U2670DYLE>  lemme see what I can get scheduled
best-case, this afternoon
hmm yeah im not clear on what that means
the /refs/for?
IIRC, you can't actually push directly to the branch
you push to a ref endpoint that routes to it
but I understand about --->this<--- much of how Gerrit works under the hood
yeah thats about as much im able to follow at the moment, doesnt help i have a headache and trying to read that doc is going no where

<@U0HP6TFNX> <@U0EL0GLEL> Wrote a User Story in Jira for this, but clarity on permissions. We need a admin role that can create/edit programs/projects/projectdetails and a Super Admin who can delete those items. Any issues?
is this a requirement, as it does add more complexity than just able to access the system or not
2 user roles?
Not questioning you. Just confirming that is what you're asking about?
yeah, there is a big difference in the concept of someone just needing permission to access the admin vs different levels of access
Ok cool. What if something (project) is accidentally during a Spring cleaning, is it recoverable?
nope delete would be gone i think, unless there was some database backup process occuring
then it would be a process to get it out of the backup
It's straightforward to design the UX for that, I would just ask from a production standpoint, is this in scope, and do we have time
Agreed. My 2 cents is we can trust someone not to go in nefariously deleting content, this is their job on the line after all, _but_ may be something we run by client

from what i can tell that is given for roles from the google app engine side, there is viewer, editor, owner for giving people permission to the app. further than that i expect they would make you do your own for that
which would mean us holding a list in the app of users, and permissions, meaning a way to manage that is needed, plus a system for the roles and what they mean
it adds a lot of complexity
All good points
what I typically do is just archive rather than delete
and then you can unarchive
sure that can be done
just a flag on the record
but that also means that there would be a lot of archived records in there eventually
and we would need some way to see archived records for the unarchive as i wouldnt expect them to be in the main list
do you worry about the eventual number of records? seems to me like they're unlikely to have hundreds of thousands
what I typically do is have a project list view in the CMS. By default, archived records are not displayed in the list. There would be a checkbox to show archived records in the list. Same screen.

ok, thats totally fair and doable just pointing it out. I’m not terribly worried about the number of records, the only real implication is database size which equates to cost of hosting usually but doubt thats of concern
im on board with archive vs delete, and a view archived button sounds good
Awesome. I'll update user stories
hey <@U0HP6TFNX> I was looking at the images, and since come of them are stats, do we have a way of differentiating them in the CMS?
<@U02F9CXTL> & I were talking about having a sort of carousel that cycled through the images, but when they have writing like a stat it takes awhile to take it in
Yes, we have a field to specify which images are stats.
Cool
it would be one of the values in the media type field
This one is classified as "image" though, and is a bar graph: <https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B4V689etGs17ZlYzZ3dFQmhDZms/view>
<@U0J6TE0CA|emilyskaer> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/emilyskaer/F3Q8RJ80G/green-wp-charts-cumulative-corporate-renewal.png|green-wp-charts-Cumulative-Corporate-Renewal.png>
Im going to need to know how that difference makes an effect, sure you can certainly have a different media type, but what makes it different, its still mechanically an image
So <@U02F9CXTL> & I were talking about some images being static, some being in a type of carousel
If theres a lot of writing to take in, we'd need more screen time
we are still able to define media types however we want, in this case, I would think we call this a chart, which might have different rules from stats and images?
we would enumerate these rules for you peter
Yeah, I would not have a chart be part of a group of images for exactly the reason you bring up Emily
be careful tho, as chart could mean image file with a chart in it but pie chart means a url to a google sheet with data to display
Yeah, we don't want someone starting to read something & then it swaps out for another image.
good point - emily, do you think the "stats" rules would apply to this type of chart image? or do we need the ability to apply different rules?
Yeah I would have the charts, stats & any other graph lumped together
Would it be useful to create a "photos" type
In addition to "image"
And only have "photos" in a slide show
The hard part is that the "Hero Image" that takes up a full screen (or as big as possible) would be drawn from a small collection of images to be in a carousel. And the "hero" is typically static.
Yeah thats smart <@U0260V4K1>
<@U0260V4K1> i like that idea
The hero image is its own thing
I know, I'm just trying to sort everything out with the images, and which ones would rotate through.
FWIW I like the idea of leaving the hero static and then setting up a slide show of other photos somewhere else...
Me too

Hey team- Looks like we are getting _real_ comfortable with this work remote thing. Love the collaboration. Given that the office is closed tomorrow, we're going to have tomorrow's meeting on GVC as well. Dennis and I just discussed and are thinking the best use of our time is to split the meeting into 2 parts.

1.) Demo of WiP by design 2.) A project planning session where we go through the User Stories in Jira and create sub-tasks for what design and/or dev needs from the other to accomplish that story and then assign that task. This should give us a pretty concrete idea of the work remaining on who has got what on their plate.
